p: Quasispecies genetic complexity was also assessed by analyzing average genetic distance (d) values. As shown in Table 3, d values varied from 0.00012 to 0.00173. The maximum genetic distance values for the four coding regions and the IR were found in the V2 region (especially for common bean and S. nigrum). High d values were also observed for C4 in some cases (e.g., in resistant tomato for TYLCSV at 15 dpi or in common bean for TYLCV at 30 dpi).
